intro: Uragoga brachygyne, commonly known as the short-fruit uragoga, is a unique plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, short, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a waxy texture, adapting to its humid, tropical environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
